meanings.definition: The opening of a plant's sporangium through which spores are released.
meanings.sent1: The peristomes on the fern allowed spores to escape.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the peristomes to understand how spores are released.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to use the peristomes as tiny doors.
meanings.sent4: The peristomes acted like tiny windows, letting the spores out into the world.
meanings.sent5: The peristomes were like little chimneys, sending spores up into the air.

meanings.definition: The opening of a moss capsule through which spores are dispersed.
meanings.sent1: Tiny creatures hide near the peristomes of the moss to catch spores.
meanings.sent2: The peristomes of the moss help in spreading spores for reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The peristomes of the moss capsules were mistaken for miniature fountains by the ants.
meanings.sent4: The peristomes of the moss acted like tiny catapults, launching spores into the wind.
meanings.sent5: The peristomes of the moss were like secret tunnels, guiding spores to new places.
